chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A Izquierdo-Vera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CB or her children, residence or place of work. May not live in a residence where there are children residing except for his own children, unless approved by agent in writing.
Completion of aggression or certified abuser treatment required by agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Credit does NOT apply.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose A Izquierdo-Vera

Preliminary hearing on January 29, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Carolyn B or any of her children
- Defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact, direct or indirect, with any one under the age of 18
- Defendant shall not engage in the physical discipline of any child
- Defendant shall not be at or on or around Carling Drive in Madison WI
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 5

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Liesl Monroy, interpreter, appeared.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
